person_1029.name: Joachim FirminJanson des Fontaines
person_1029.description: A French Engineer. This is possibly who Davy is referencing in his table of mountain heights but the exact work referenced remains untraced.

person_1024.name: Jean-FrançoisBerger
person_1024.description: Swiss natural philosopher and physician with interests in geology,natural history, and physiology.

person_520.name: Jean-AndréDeluc
person_520.description: Swiss-born geologist, natural philosopher and meteorologist who spent much of his time working in England. FRSL.

person_1032.name: Chrysologuede Gy
person_1032.description: Noël André (1728 - 1808), French astronomer, cartographer and geologist who as a Capuchin monk took the name Chrysologue de Gy. He wrote Théorie de la surface actuelle de la terre (Paris, 1806)

person_531.name: Jean-JosephVidal
person_531.description: French astronomer who with Henri Reboul first climbed the Turon de Neouvielle in the Pyrenees in 1787.

person_532.name: HenriReboul
person_532.description: French chemist who with Jean-Joseph Vidal climbed the Turon de Neouvielle in the Pyrenees in 1787.

person_351.name: François-Étiennede La Roche
person_351.description: Genevan physician, naturalist, chemist, botanist, and ichthyologist.

person_1022.name: BoyleRoche
person_1022.description: Irish politician most remembered for getting his metaphors mixed up.

person_050.name: Louis NicolasVauquelin
person_050.description: French pharmacist and chemist who met Davy in Paris in 1813. ForMemRSL.

person_672.name: Jacques ÉtienneBérard
person_672.description: French naturalist, chemist and physicist who worked in Paris and Montpellier.

person_396.name: Friedrich Albrecht CarlGren
person_396.description: German chemist and pharmacist who sought to combine phlogiston with Lavoiser's oxygen theory.

person_012.name: Joseph LouisGay-Lussac
person_012.description: French chemist and physicist, known mostly for his discovery that water is made of two parts hydrogen and one part oxygen by volume (with Alexander von Humboldt), for two laws related to gases, and for his work on alcohol-water mixtures. Became involved in controversies with Davy over various chemical discoveries. ForMemRSL.

person_201.name: Louis JacquesThénard
person_201.description: Held chairs of chemistry at the Collège de France and the Ecole Polytechnique. Worked closely with Gay-Lussac and met Davy in Paris in 1813. ForMemRSL.

place_1275.name: Hautes-Alpes
place_1275.description: Hautes-Alpes is a department in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region of Southeastern France.

place_783.name: Monte Viso
place_783.description: A mountain peak in the Guil valley, Piedmont, Italy.

place_1276.name: Guil
place_1276.description: A long river in the Hautes-Alpes, France.

place_1277.name: Durance
place_1277.description: a major river in Southeastern France. A left tributary of the Rhône, it is 323.2 km long.

place_1278.name: La Grave
place_1278.description: a commune in the Hautes-Alpes department in southeastern France.

place_1280.name: Aiguilles d'Arves
place_1280.description: a mountain in the Arves massif in the French Alps. The mountain, comprising three separate peaks (in French Aiguille), is the highest point of the massif. Davy refers to it as Les Trois Ellions

place_1281.name: Col du Lautaret
place_1281.description: a high mountain pass in the department of Hautes-Alpes in France. Davy's measurement refers to the hospice along this route.

place_1283.name: Plampinet
place_1283.description: A hamlet in the French commune of Névache.

place_1287.name: Cervières
place_1287.description: a commune in the Hautes-Alpes department in southeastern France.

place_1288.name: St. Veran
place_1288.description: a commune in the Hautes-Alpes department in southeastern France

place_1289.name: Col Agnel
place_1289.description: a mountain pass in the Cottian Alps, west of Monte Viso between France and Italy

place_1290.name: Nière
place_1290.description: a mountain ridge in the Hautes Alpes, France

place_1291.name: Ristolas
place_1291.description: a former commune in the Hautes-Alpes department in southeastern France.

place_1309.name: Mont de Mauren
place_1309.description: Possibly Mären, a mountain peak in Switzerland.

place_1292.name: Mont de l'oursine
place_1292.description: A mountain in the Hauts-Alpes just north of Villard d'Arene mentioned by several historical sources, its current name remains untraced.

place_1293.name: Monts Chiracs
place_1293.description: Mountains near Champoléon, France. Their exact location remains untraced.

place_1294.name: Mont Bonvoisin
place_1294.description: a mountain in the Massif des Écrins in France.

place_1295.name: Soleil-Bian
place_1295.description: a mountain which is the source of the river Rabious, it's modern name remains untraced.

place_1296.name: Mont Guillaume
place_1296.description: a mountain in the Hautes Alpes, France

place_1297.name: Joug de l'Aigle
place_1297.description: a mountain in the Hautes Alpes, France

place_1298.name: Parpaillon
place_1298.description: a mountain chain in the French Alps.

place_1299.name: Alpes Maritimes
place_1299.description: a department in southeast France that includes part of the Côte d’Azur.

place_1300.name: Mont de la Bataille
place_1300.description: a mountain above the commune of Turbie, France

place_1301.name: Montagne d'Eza
place_1301.description: a mountain above the commune of Eze, France

place_1302.name: Aveyron
place_1302.description: Aveyron is a department in southern France.

place_355.name: Rhone River
place_355.description: A major river in France and Switzerland.

place_757.name: Aix-en-Provence
place_757.description: Aix is a town in southern France, once the capital of the region of Provence.

place_1024.name: Seine River
place_1024.description: A river in northern France. Its drainage basin is in the Paris Basin covering most of northern France.

place_634.name: Chamechaude
place_634.description: A mountain peak in Isère, France.

place_636.name: The Chartreuse Mountains
place_636.description: A mountain range in south-eastern France.

place_638.name: Col d'Ornon
place_638.description: Col d'Ornon is a mountain pass through the Dauphiné Alps in the department of Isère in France.

place_639.name: Chantelouve
place_639.description: A former commune in Isère, France.

place_642.name: Lac Laffrey
place_642.description: Lac Laffrey is a lake in Isère, France.

place_627.name: Confignon
place_627.description: A municipality of the canton of Geneva.

place_629.name: Notre dame d'abondance
place_629.description: Abondance is a French town on the south side of Lake Geneva.

place_226.name: Geneva
place_226.description: Geneva is a city in Switzerland on the border with France.

place_998.name: Pyrenees
place_998.description: The Pyrenees mountain range separates the Iberian Peninsula from the rest of Europe, stretching more than 430km between Spain and France and rising higher than 3,400m in elevation.

place_657.name: Canigou
place_657.description: A mountain peak located in the Pyrenees of southern France. Davy made sketches and wrote a poem about The Canigou in notebook 14I.

place_948.name: Ala
place_948.description: A comune in Trentino, north-eastern Italy.

place_895.name: Kammer
place_895.description: Today the Schloss Kammer - Kammer Castle is situated on a peninsula, originally on an island in the northern Attersee

place_647.name: Roč
place_647.description: A mountain in the Tarn region, France.

place_648.name: Mount Ramus, St Thibery
place_648.description: A volcano near the village of St Thibery, France, which has basalt columns.

place_660.name: Volcán
place_660.description: A volcano in the Pyrenees, also known as Mont Saint-Loup.

place_649.name: Fort de Valros
place_649.description: A castle, known locally as the Tour de Valros, inland from Agde in France.

place_445.name: Puy-de-Dôme
place_445.description: Puy de Dome is a lava dome in the Massif Central of France.

place_301.name: County Antrim
place_301.description: A county in north-eastern Northern Ireland.

place_467.name: St Thibery Volcano, Mont Ramus
place_467.description: St Thibery (extinct) Volcano (Mont Ramus) is located in the Languedoc region of southern France.

place_1274.name: Abbey of Saint-Martin-du-Canigou
place_1274.description: a monastery built in 1009 in the Pyrenees of Northern Catalonia on Canigou mountain in present-day southern France near the Spanish border.

place_1259.name: St Moritz
place_1259.description: An alpine town in Switzerland’s Engadin valley.

place_807.name: Gibraltar
place_807.description: Gibraltar is a British Overseas Territory and headland, on Spain's south coast.

place_808.name: Montserrat
place_808.description: Montserrat, in the Leeward Islands. Historically returned to Britain under the 1783 Treaty of Paris.

place_243.name: Carrara
place_243.description: Carrara is a city in central Italy.

place_537.name: River Colne
place_537.description: The River Colne is a tributary of the River Thames.

place_529.name: Tivoli, Lazio
place_529.description: Tivoli is a town north east of Rome and known for the waterfall on the Aniene River.

place_527.name: Aniene River
place_527.description: The Aniene is a river rising in the Apennines and flowing west to join the Tiber in northern Rome. It is famous for the Tivoli waterfall.

place_528.name: Solfatara Caldera
place_528.description: Solfatara di Pozzuoli is a volcanic crater near Naples. Though a dormant volcano, it emits jets of steam and sulphurous fumes.

place_530.name: Apennines
place_530.description: The Apennines are a range of mountains that run down the spine of peninsular Italy.

place_540.name: Alps Limestone
place_540.description: The Limestone Alps are made up of three main mountain ranges in the European Alps - in the north, south, and west of the main Alpine mountain range.

place_615.name: Tiber River
place_615.description: The Tiber River is the third longest river in Italy. Rome is located on its banks.

place_822.name: Monti Cimini
place_822.description: A volcanic mountain range along the shores of Lake Vico in Central Italy.

place_1260.name: Lake Bolsena
place_1260.description: A lake of volcanic origin in the northern part of the province of Viterbo called Alto Lazio or Tuscia in central Italy. It is the largest volcanic lake in Europe.

place_1080.name: Florence
place_1080.description: The capital city of the Italian region of Tuscany.

place_741.name: Siena
place_741.description: A city in Tuscany, and the capital of the Province of Siena.

place_743.name: Radicofani
place_743.description: A town in the Province of Siena, Italy.

place_538.name: Liguria
place_538.description: Liguria is a region of north west Italy. Its capital is Genoa.

place_806.name: St Thibery
place_806.description: Saint-Thibéry is a commune in the Hérault department in the Occitanie region of southern France. The village of Saint-Thibéry is built at the confluence of the Rivers Thongue and Hérault.

place_809.name: Pyrénées-Orientales
place_809.description: The Eastern Pyrenees, also known as North Catalonia.

place_834.name: Saint-Hilaire-de-Beauvoir
place_834.description: A commune in the Aude department in the Occitanie region in southern France.

place_833.name: Fontès
place_833.description: A commune in the Hérault department in southern France.

place_839.name: Cévennes
place_839.description: A range of mountains in south-central France, on the south-east edge of the Massif Central.

place_745.name: Languedoc
place_745.description: Languedoc is a historical province of France located on the south coast.

place_821.name: Étang de Thau
place_821.description: The largest string of lagoons (étang) that stretch along the French coast from the Rhone to the Pyrenees.

place_1261.name: Auvergne
place_1261.description: A region of central France known for its mountain ranges and dormant volcanoes.

place_840.name: Beaulieu
place_840.description: An extinct volcano near Aix, France.

place_845.name: Little Hungarian Plain
place_845.description: The Little Hungarian Plain or Little Alföld is a plain in north-western Hungary, south-western Slovakia, and eastern Austria. It is a part of the Pannonian plain which covers most parts of Hungary.

place_1262.name: Catalonia
place_1262.description: A region in north-eastern Spain. Barcelona is the regional capital.

otherwork_303.name: Description Abrégée du Département des Hautes-Alpes
otherwork_303.author: Pierre-Antoine Farnaud

otherwork_304.name: Journal de Physique, de Chimie, et d'Histoire Naturelle
otherwork_304.author: Louis-Étienne Héricart de Thury

otherwork_306.name: Mesures barométriques, suivies de quelques observations d'histoire naturelle et de physique faites dans les Alpes françaises et d'un précis de la météorologie d'Avignon
otherwork_306.author: Joseph Guérin

otherwork_307.name: Observations Made in Savoy, In Order to Ascertain the Height of Mountains by Means of the Barometer; Being an Examination of Mr. De Luc's Rules Delivered in His Recherches Sur Les Modifications de L'Atmosphere
otherwork_307.author: George Shuckburgh
